title: cryptobro777
author: cryptobro777
content: I have recently joined the exciting field of cryptocurrencies and heard about this forum as a perfect launchpad to start my journey. Honestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. After roaming around in this forum, now I am little bit confused where to start. So here I invite all experience members to give your valuable thoughts and guidance for me.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk forum, there are actually enough things to learn in the forum which I am sure will be interacting to you as a beginner.Going through your posting history, I saw that almost all of your comments were off topic, and now you're writing a piece expressing your interest in bounty only to get free tokens that are basically worthless.I will advice you to go through Newbies Read before posting in order to get some basic insight on how to participate properly in this forum.Moreover, focus on learning and leave anything aside for now so that you will have the basic knowledge about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk.Whatever you might have heard or read about this forum is correct, if you're her to get knowledge or get started with crypto then you're at the right place. And I'll be quoting my recent post just so I won't be repeating myself.Quote from: Cantsay on July 11, 2023, 09:10:25 PMTo learn about Bitcoin technical aspect I recommend this material.https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chaptersWhen dealing with Bitcoin you'll realize how important privacy and security is, so I'd recommend the following links to help you learn more about them.https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlYou can still use this site to learn more about Bitcoin.https://coindesk.com/learnhttps://learnmeabitcoin.com/https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/Another material that I have used in the past most especially when I was new to the forum was: Beginners & Help EncyclopediaIt's has some materials already arranged for you, it's not only for Bitcoin though.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: For bounty check the  bounty section  I don't know about now, but I don't think the bounty section are still given any huge reward to members for there are lot of projects who are out their but not with genuine intention as they always pay little to nothing to participants. I will advice you to focus on building your self with general crypto knowledge so that you can learn how it works, how the trading section and every other part which could be beneficial to you. the forum is broad and you can learn lot of things aside the bounty earning.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Don't be hasty about those opportunities you are thinking in your mind. If you're all for the bounties, we've got a dedicated section on it and it's on the Bounties (Altcoins).But before that, learn more about the forum including the forum rules which is included on the link that's given to you. It's more than the bounties that you'll learn here so don't rush into those bounties for which many of them are likely scams.

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: because your rank is still a Newbie. you can only participate in social media campaigns and maybe other campaigns besides signature. even some managers have a minimum of activity for members with the rank of Newbie. I hope you understand this, but if you are really interested then you can visit the Bounty board.but my advice is not to focus too much on Bounty or Airdrop campaigns. it will waste your time and most of it really doesn't pay you well.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: cryptobro777 on July 22, 2023, 12:12:30 PMI have recently joined the exciting field of cryptocurrencies and heard about this forum as a perfect launchpad to start my journey. Honestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. I thank you for your honesty, but the free methods usually require repetitive, boring, very low-return work with long periods of sitting. Instead, use your time to learn freelancers skills or develop your skills to create high-quality posts and earn an average of $200 per month from signature campaigns after about 6 months.Start with YouTube channels and read some books, try to learn new information daily and ask about it here.you can earn from some paid Bitcointalk Games topics or for review services.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: cryptobro777 on July 22, 2023, 12:12:30 PMI have recently joined the exciting field of cryptocurrencies and heard about this forum as a perfect launchpad to start my journey. Honestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. After roaming around in this forum, now I am little bit confused where to start. So here I invite all experience members to give your valuable thoughts and guidance for meAtleast start from somewhere, but I will not support you to start with bounties, you need to learn about bitcoin, try to understand how the forum operates, get used to the forum's rules and regulations, read more and learn more to have something good to offer to others, i don't want you to see this place as a money making opportunity or avenue to quickly arrived in life, what can get you noticed and have early arrival is what you've learnt so far from here, which means you will do much of reading, learning than postings and hunting after bounties for now.Helpful threads.posting etiquetteshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5184741.0#post_altgiveawayeverything you need to know about forum rank, activities and merits.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0bitcoin historyhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438353.0Beginners and Help Encyclopediahttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.0

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I don't know how determined you are to learn about crypto currency, but if you have the time to learn, I will suggest you visit most of the links shared by Cantsay, as they will be very helpful to you in your crypto journey.As for bounty, there are links dropped here for you to follow down to the bounty section, but if you take bounty as your full-time job, it might not give you the kind of earning you need, for the era where airdrops usually benefit members with huge rewards is far gone. But you can give it a try and see if it will work for you. If not, I could have personally advised you to learn more about how the system works, wallet security, privacy, and all the rest so that you can be a holder with so much knowledge about Bitcoin and crypto in general and not just some newbies who can easily be persuaded over something they have knowledge about.

comments.author: knowngunman
comments.body: Quote from: cryptobro777 on July 22, 2023, 12:12:30 PMI have recently joined the exciting field of cryptocurrencies and heard about this forum as a perfect launchpad to start my journey. Honestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. After roaming around in this forum, now I am little bit confused where to start. So here I invite all experience members to give your valuable thoughts and guidance for me.Â  You're most welcome to one of the best crypto discussing platform. It's important for one to get self acquainted with the rules in every environment you found yourself in, so as to not be involved in anything not wanted in that particular place. To familiarize yourself with the community rules, I will redirect you to this welcome message. The basic things you need to know about the forum is contain therein, you may also need to see this rules and guidelines too.You made your intention very obvious which is not bad but the forum is far more beyond bounty and free earning opportunity. We have experts in this forum from various area relating to crypto, technology, marketing, politics and every aspect you can think of. You can also take your time to learn a lot from this people by asking questions just as you did and you can as well make your contribution in the area you have knowledge in. Joining this forum for the purpose of earning is not bad but gaining knowledge supersede as it's widely believed that knowledge is wealth.Bounty and other related stuff are being discuss here . Take time to look at it since it's your priority for now but I bet you as time goes on you will realize you need more than bounty here.Once again, welcome!

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: Quote from: cryptobro777 on July 22, 2023, 12:12:30 PMI have recently joined the exciting field of cryptocurrencies and heard about this forum as a perfect launchpad to start my journey. Honestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. After roaming around in this forum, now I am little bit confused where to start. So here I invite all experience members to give your valuable thoughts and guidance for me.Â  Don't expect that there's someone will guide you but do your best to know more information about crypto. There are to many information posted and you can research and read all contents which you think can help you. There are also educational videos that might help you so try to exert more efforts for gaining knowledge since this is ideal for newbie who want to start up good in their participation on cryptocurrency space.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Your post history is all shit posts Â https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3567658;sa=showPostsI guess this topic will be moved to off topic board too just like others. If you continue, you even will be nuked.I feel any advice to this poster is useless but just in case, [Guide] Searching effectively to find available topics and answers for future questions. If you use searching well, you will not need to create many topics to ask.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: Quote from: Nwada001 on July 22, 2023, 01:07:06 PM If not, I could have personally advised you to learn more about how the system works, wallet security, privacy, and all the rest so that you can be a holder with so much knowledge about Bitcoin and crypto in general and not just some newbies who can easily be persuaded over something they have knowledge about.I support your suggestion more to the OP. as he was previously only active on the Off-Topic boards with a few of his posts. if OP is interested in a bounty campaign I'm afraid he will be trapped there by only working on social media bounty reports that fill his post history.You will also see accounts with registrations several years ago whose entire post history is a report of bounty campaigns. I'm afraid it will also happen to him.come on Op, you can do better in this forum. if you are interested in the bounty campaign, no one will blame you. but at least learn what is important for you to have.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: cryptobro777 on July 22, 2023, 12:12:30 PMHonestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. Bounty campaigns is not worthy to join anymore because most of them is scam. Signature campaign and Job offer on the services section is the only way now to earn profit here. If you want to start earning, Try to familiarize the forum by reading the rules https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0. Then contribute in the forum to rank up your account by engaging to other user by constructive post. All the earning part will be follow once you are an established member here because you can't participate in the signature campaigns or offer a service here if you are complete newbie.

comments.author: Agbamoni
comments.body: It is obvious that you have been in this forum before or have had experience one way or the other. You roamed around the forum in just two hours, and you already know a lot about bounties and the other earning opportunities. All I see is someone who wants to rank up and Goodluck with that.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: cryptobro777 on July 22, 2023, 12:12:30 PMHonestly as a beginner, I'm eager to participate in bounty campaigns and explore various free earning opportunities. After roaming around in this forum, now I am little bit confused where to start. So here I invite all experience members to give your valuable thoughts and guidance for me.Â  If you say yourself new here, you should not be too early to think about campaigns or earnings, there are many things you should learn first here before you start all that.Forums have rules that you have to learn, campaigns also have rules that you have to know, for that before you understand all of that, you should first learn how crypto/Bitcoin works, we are not here as directly as you mean, we need to study a lot here 1-2 years to get to know everything, whereas you registered today directly asking for money and campaigns, I think you are in a hurry for that.Everything needs a process, it's not as easy as turning the palm of the hand, understand everything that's here first, the terms and conditions that pass.

comments.author: zaim7413
comments.body: Welcome to the forum.Don't think too far, friend, if your motivation is to immediately join the Bitcoin Paid Signature Campaign or the new Altcoin Bounty Campaign, you will be disappointed if your goals are not achieved or difficult to achieve. Now what you need to do is understand all the rules that are allowed on the forum and all the rules that are prohibited, as a newcomer to the forum you need to learn more to gain knowledge that can make it easier for you to adapt to more senior members.Confused you feel now because you have not adapted well in the forum, take the time to read the topics that can lead you in a better direction.

comments.author: cryptobro777
comments.body: Quote from: Hyphen(-) on July 22, 2023, 12:23:44 PMWelcome to Bitcointalk forum, there are actually enough things to learn in the forum which I am sure will be interacting to you as a beginner.Going through your posting history, I saw that almost all of your comments were off topic, and now you're writing a piece expressing your interest in bounty only to get free tokens that are basically worthless.I will advice you to go through Newbies Read before posting in order to get some basic insight on how to participate properly in this forum.Moreover, focus on learning and leave anything aside for now so that you will have the basic knowledge about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency.As a beginner, I felt little complicated in posting in other sections such as bitcoin, altcoin discussion, etc. That's why I went towards off-topic section. I also found some threads about bounty campaign and airdrop related posts. Then thought I can participate those tasks. Thus I start a thread to ask where should I start.But now I feel, I do something wrong here. I will definitely go through the mentioned post to gather details for future postings.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: It doesn't look like you will do very well on this forum OP, I look through your post history and it is not looking average, not even close to average poster, you need to improve on your posting on this forum, what you've did so far is what every shit posters have done, be more creative with posts and also engage in discussions more.There are many things a newbie must be lacking in crypto space, are you not curious to know more about some things? Or maybe you are a shit poster because if your aim? A bounty hunter that earns money through a signature campaign? If this is your goal you will keep messing up.Be willing to learn first, this is what will improve your knowledge on the forum and maybe you can then later consider signature campaigns.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Common advice: "there is no free lunch", meaning you have to have something like a skill to stand a chance. There are more worthy "jobs" to do than bounty campaigns, with the chance of being paid higher. You should check the following sections:Services: You can enter contests and review campaigns, or you can offer your own services.Games and rounds: There is free (limited) draws/raffles with simple tasks there.But I agree with all the opinions above, with your status as a beginner it's better to get a lot of crypto knowledge first than to jump into looking for free income. Don't forget to stick to the forum rules or you will be eliminated.
